newsitem.title: ARMENIA: Armenian copper, molybdenum plant reopens.
newsitem.headline: Armenian copper, molybdenum plant reopens.

text.p: Armenia's state-owned copper and molybdenum plant reopened on March 1 after a three-month shutdown for repairs, an Industry Ministry official said on Wednesday.
The official said the Zangezur Copper-Molybdenum Plant, located 150 km east of the capital Yerevan, had restarted on March 1 as previously scheduled.
"The plant is functioning normally," said the official, adding that it planned to produce 3,400 tonnes of molybdenum concentrate and 5,000 tonnes of copper concentrate in 1997.

The plant produced 3,116 tonnes of molybdenum concentrate and 4,483 tonnes of copper concentrate in 1996, of which about 90 percent was exported to neighbouring Iran. Ores used in processing are obtained from local mines.
